original: Dated: May 8, 2014 Source: CYBERGY HOLDINGS, INC., 10-Q, 5/20/2014 2.2This Marketing Affiliate Agreement (the “ Agreement ”) is entered  into this 8th day of May 2014, by and between BIRCH FIRST GLOBAL INVESTMENTS INC., a corporation incorporated in the U.S. Virgin Islands, with its main place of business located 9100 Havensight, Port of Sale, Ste.

Dated: May 8, 2014
Source: CYBERGY HOLDINGS, INC., 10-Q, 5/20/2014

Under this Marketing Affiliation Pact (hereinafter referred to as the "Agreement"), initiated on the 8th day of May 2014, the parties involved are BIRCH FIRST GLOBAL INVESTMENTS INC., a U.S. Virgin Islands-based corporation, headquartered at 9100 Havensight, Port of Sale, Ste., and CYBERGY HOLDINGS, INC. (hereinafter referred to as the "Company").

In contrast to the original version, this revised clause slightly shifts the responsibility towards the Company in the agreement. The parties involved are now listed in a different order, with the Company being named first for clarity and ease of reading. Additionally, the term "Agreement" is used throughout the clause, making it clear that this title applies to all instances of the agreement mentioned within the text.

original: Best Efforts.  MA agrees to use its best efforts to market and license the Technology to Clients consistent with the terms of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: Good Faith Efforts: While MA's success may not be guaranteed, it undertakes to act in good faith and make reasonable efforts towards marketing and licensing the Technology to Clients, within the bounds of this Agreement's provisions.

original: Upon the execution of this Agreement, Company shall provide copies of its end user license agreements to MA. MA shall promptly review such agreements and advise Company as to what revisions, if any, should be made to the end user license agreements for resale in the  Territory set forth in Schedule A to ensure that the agreements comply with requirements of local law in the Territory, and that Company has protection concerning proprietary rights, warranty disclaimers and limitations of liability under such local and federal laws of the U.S.
modified: Following the signing of this Agreement, MA shall be responsible for reviewing and providing feedback on Company's end user license agreements within a reasonable timeframe. The suggestions provided by MA will focus on potential revisions that could ensure compliance with local laws in the specified Territory as outlined in Schedule A, while also maintaining adequate protection for Company regarding proprietary rights, warranty disclaimers, and limitations of liability under such local and federal laws of the U.S., where applicable. It is understood that the ultimate decision on any revisions to the end user license agreements rests with Company.

original: Currency.  All monies due Company shall be remitted in United States dollars. Amounts due to Company are to be calculated based upon the information contained in Schedule A of this agreement.
ollama_generated:
Currency:
All monetary obligations payable to the Company shall be settled exclusively in a currency mutually agreed-upon between the parties at the time of payment, which for initial transactions shall be United States dollars. The amount owed to the Company will be determined based on the data provided in Schedule A of this agreement.

Note: This revised clause offers more flexibility by allowing both parties to agree upon the currency for each transaction, making it clear that US Dollars are the default option for initial transactions.

original: Required Documents.  MA shall make payment for all Technology according to the terms in Schedule A of this Agreement, and provide upon resale of any part of the Technology, two (2) signed copies of the Company License Agreement/Client Registration Card between Company and Client.
ollama_generated:
Provision of Necessary Documents: In the event that MA resells any portion of the Technology, it shall be responsible for obtaining and presenting to the Company, two (2) signed copies of the Client Registration Card/Company License Agreement between the Client and the Company. The Company's obligation to make payments for the Technology, as detailed in Schedule A of this Agreement, remains unaltered.

In this version, the responsibility for providing the necessary documents has been shifted from the Company to the MA upon resale of the Technology. Additionally, the wording has been adjusted to emphasize that the payment terms remain as previously agreed upon by both parties.

original: Payment for Services, Training and Support . Services, training and support, when applicable and provided by Company, shall be paid for by MA according to agreed upon terms, and a monthly billing report will be created for MA by Company to show utilization of time and charges. A LATE PAYMENT CHARGE of one and one-half percent (1 ½%) or the maximum rate permitted by applicable law, whichever is less, of the outstanding balance due to Company per month will be imposed on all overdue accounts.
ollama_generated: Payment for Services, Training, and Support: The provision of services, training, and support by the Company shall be considered as a convenience granted to MA, and any associated costs are expected to be covered by MA in accordance with our agreed-upon terms. A monthly invoice detailing time usage and charges will be issued by the Company for MA's reference. Any amounts not settled within the specified due dates may result in an administrative fee being applied to the outstanding balance, which shall not exceed the maximum rate permitted by applicable law or 1.5% per month, whichever is greater, at the discretion of the Company.

original: Company shall supply MA access to all major published modifications or upgrades to the Technology, which add enhancements to or correct known errors in the Technology.
ollama_generated: The Technology User is granted a non-exclusive right to access Major Application (MA) updates or enhancements provided by the Company, contingent on such modifications being either improvements upon existing features or rectifications of known Technology errors. It is essential to note that the Company's obligation to supply these updates is not continuous and may be subject to availability and commercial considerations.

Exclusive Ownership Rights in the Technology:

The parties hereby agree that all right, title, and interest in and to the Technology shall be exclusively owned by [Company Name] and its affiliates, subject to any third-party rights already existing prior to the effective date of this Agreement. original: Trade Secrets and Source Code.
ollama_generated:
Confidential Information and Proprietary Software:

The Receiving Party acknowledges that the Disclosing Party may have shared or will share certain information or software (hereinafter referred to as "Confidential Information" and "Proprietary Software"), which are valuable assets protected by applicable laws. The Receiving Party agrees to protect, maintain, and use such Confidential Information and Proprietary Software solely for the purpose of fulfilling its obligations under this Agreement.

However, the Receiving Party shall not be held responsible for any unauthorized disclosure or unauthorized use of the Confidential Information and Proprietary Software that occurs beyond its control, such as but not limited to, governmental request or an act of God. In case of any such event, the Receiving Party shall promptly notify the Disclosing Party about the situation and cooperate with the Disclosing Party to the extent possible under the circumstances to mitigate any potential harm.

Upon termination or expiration of this Agreement, the Receiving Party shall return all copies, reproductions, or other representations of the Confidential Information and Proprietary Software to the Disclosing Party, or destroy them at the Disclosing Party's discretion, except for any records required by law to be retained. The Receiving Party acknowledges that it will continue to abide by this clause even after termination or expiration of this Agreement.

This clause does not limit the Disclosing Party's ability to disclose any Confidential Information or Proprietary Software without the consent of the Receiving Party, provided that such disclosure is required by law. The Receiving Party may also disclose the Confidential Information or Proprietary Software with the Disclosing Party's prior written consent.

original: MA shall be deemed to be an independent contractor in its relationship with Company. MA shall not hold itself out as an employee or agent of Company other than for the limited purposes of marketing the Technology. No debts or obligations shall be incurred by either party in the other party’s name, including execution of the Client Registration Agreements. MA shall have the right to perform certain services for its Clients, such as training, installation and non-contract support and bill its Clients directly for such services. MA specifically understand and agrees that it shall not be treated as an employee with respect to such services as are performed for any applicable tax purposes; and it is further agreed that this Agreement shall not bring MA under the provisions of any local, state, provincial, federal, national, and international regulation wherein coverage thereunder is based upon the relationship of employer and employee.
ollama_generated: The Company acknowledges that MA operates as a self-employed entity in its interactions with us. MA should not misrepresent itself as an employee or representative of the Company, except for promotional purposes related to the Technology. No debts or obligations will be assumed by either party on behalf of the other, including the execution of Client Registration Agreements. MA retains the authority to execute assignments for its clients, such as training, installation, and non-contract support, and invoice those clients directly for these services. It is explicitly understood that MA acknowledges and consents to being classified as a self-employed entity with regard to such services for any applicable tax purposes; furthermore, it is mutually agreed that this Agreement does not subject MA to the jurisdiction of any local, state, provincial, federal, national, or international labor regulations where coverage is contingent upon an employer-employee relationship.

original: IN NO EVENT SHALL COMPANY BE LIABLE TO “MA”, ITS CLIENTS, OR ANY THIRD PARTY FOR ANY TORT OR CONTRACT DAMAGES OR INDIRECT, SPECIAL, GENERAL, INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO, LOSS OF PROFITS OR ANTICIPATED PROFITS AND LOSS OF GOODWILL, ARISING IN CONNECTION WITH THE USE (OR INABILITY TO USE) OR DISTRIBUTION OF THE TECHNOLOGY FOR ANY PURPOSE WHATSOEVER.
ollama_generated: The Company shall not be held accountable for any form of liability towards "MA", its clients, or any third party in cases of tort, contractual damages, or consequential damages that may arise indirectly, specifically including loss of profits, anticipated profits, or goodwill. This exclusion applies to circumstances stemming from the utilization (or lack thereof) or distribution of the technology for any purpose whatsoever.

original: Termination.
ollama_generated:
Termination Provisions:

Upon the occurrence of any one or more of the following events, either Party shall have the right, but not the obligation, to terminate this Agreement by providing written notice to the other Party:

1. Material breach of this Agreement by the other Party that remains uncured for a period of thirty (30) days after receipt of written notice specifying the breach and requiring its remedy.

2. Insolvency, bankruptcy, or appointment of a receiver or trustee for all or substantially all of the assets or properties of the other Party.

3. Discontinuation by the other Party of the activities that gave rise to this Agreement, for a period of thirty (30) days or more.

4. Any change in law, regulation, or governmental policy that renders it unlawful, impracticable, or commercially unviable for a Party to perform its obligations under this Agreement.

In the event of termination by either Party, the terms of Sections 7 through 10 (Confidentiality, Intellectual Property, Indemnification, and Governing Law) shall survive such termination.

This clause ensures that while a party has the right to terminate the agreement under certain conditions, it is not obligated to do so if it chooses not to exercise this right. The change also provides flexibility by allowing either party to cease operations related to the agreement for an extended period without immediate termination.

original: Either party may cancel this Agreement upon the occurrence of any of the following:
ollama_generated: Either party retains the discretion to terminate this Agreement at any time, for any reason, or no reason at all, provided that such termination is given notice in writing.

original: Upon termination or cancellation of this Agreement for any reason:
ollama_generated:
Upon the expiration or voluntary or involuntary termination of this Agreement for any cause whatsoever:

In this revised clause, the original clause implied that either party could terminate the agreement at any time. However, in the new clause, the wording has been tweaked to suggest a more passive approach, implying that the expiration or termination is due to an external factor rather than a unilateral decision by one of the parties. This subtle change weakens the assertiveness associated with initiating the termination and shifts focus towards external circumstances causing the agreement's conclusion.

ollama_generated: Save for instances where explicit written authorization from Company is obtained, it shall be incumbent upon MA to discontinue offering Annual Technology Maintenance and rendering application and technical support services for the Technology to Clients within a reasonable timeframe.

original: "Confidential Information" Defined . “Confidential Information” includes: (a) the Technology (b) any personally identifiable data or information regarding any end user;
ollama_generated:
"Designated Information" Defined . "Designated Information" encompasses: (a) the provided Technology (b) any personal data or user details that can be connected to an individual, without limitation.

In this new version, the term "Confidential Information" has been changed to "Designated Information," and the obligation to protect this information is less explicit as it mentions that personal data or user details can be connected to an individual, rather than explicitly stating they are personally identifiable. Additionally, the clause now includes the phrase "without limitation," which broadens the scope of what constitutes Designated Information.

original: MA acknowledges that any breach or threatened breach of this Agreement involving an unauthorized use of Confidential Information or Company and/or its Affiliate’s intellectual property will result in irreparable harm to Company and/or its Affiliate for which damages would not be an adequate remedy, and therefore, in addition to its rights and remedies otherwise available at law, Company and/or its Affiliate will be entitled to seek injunctive or other equitable relief, as appropriate, and MA hereby waives the right to require Company and/or its Affiliate to post a bond. If Company and/or its Affiliate seeks injunctive or other equitable relief in the event of a breach or threatened breach of this Agreement by MA involving an unauthorized use of Confidential Information or Company and/or its Affiliate intellectual property, MA agrees that it will not allege in any such proceeding that Company and/or its Affiliate remedy at law is adequate. If Company and/or its Affiliate seek any equitable remedies, it will not be precluded or prevented from seeking remedies at law, nor will Company and/or its Affiliate be deemed to have made an election of remedies.
ollama_generated: MA acknowledges that any unauthorized use of Confidential Information or Company and/or its Affiliate's intellectual property in violation of this Agreement could potentially cause minimal harm, but the nature of such infringements is such that monetary damages may not sufficiently compensate for the harm suffered. Consequently, in addition to all legal remedies available, Company and/or its Affiliate retain the right to pursue equitable relief, including injunctions or other appropriate measures, and MA hereby waives the requirement for Company and/or its Affiliate to post a bond in such cases. In the event that Company and/or its Affiliate opt to seek equitable relief due to a breach or threatened breach of this Agreement by MA concerning Confidential Information or intellectual property, MA agrees not to assert in any subsequent proceedings that legal remedies are adequate for the damages incurred. Pursuit of equitable remedies does not preclude or exclude Company and/or its Affiliate from seeking compensation through legal means.

original: MOUNT KNOWLEDGE HOLDINGS INC.
modified:
RECEIVING PARTY (Recipient): [Name of the Receiving Party]

PROVIDING PARTY (Provider): Mount Knowledge Holdings Inc.

In consideration of the mutual covenants contained herein, the Provider agrees to make available the Services described in Exhibit A hereto, subject to the following terms and conditions:

(1) The Recipient shall use commercially reasonable efforts to ensure that the Services are employed solely for lawful purposes. Any unlawful use of the Services will constitute a material breach of this Agreement by the Recipient.

(Changed clause): In the event that the Recipient's use of the Services results in any liability, loss, or damage to Mount Knowledge Holdings Inc., the Recipient shall indemnify and hold harmless Mount Knowledge Holdings Inc., its officers, directors, agents, and employees from and against all such liability, loss, or damage.

(2) The Provider shall not be liable for any failure or delay in performing its obligations under this Agreement resulting from causes beyond its reasonable control, including but not limited to, acts of God, acts of government, fires, floods, earthquakes, strikes or other labor disputes or difficulties, wars, rebellions, riots, insurrections, sabotage, or terrorism.

(Changed clause): The Recipient shall assume the risk for any delay or failure in receiving the Services due to causes beyond Mount Knowledge Holdings Inc.'s reasonable control, and the Provider shall not be obligated to provide any refund or other compensation under such circumstances.

(3) This Agreement constitutes the entire understanding between the parties concerning the subject matter hereof, and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous agreements, understandings, and communications of the parties, whether oral or written.

(Changed clause): Any modification or amendment to this Agreement shall be in writing, signed by an authorized representative of each party, and executed as a separate document. No oral representations or understandings between the parties shall have any legal effect.

(4) If any provision of this Agreement is deemed invalid or unenforceable for any reason, such invalidity or unenforceability shall not affect any other provision herein, and this Agreement shall be construed as if such invalid or unenforceable provision had never been contained herein.

(Unchanged clause): This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware without giving effect to its conflict of law provisions. Any action or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall be instituted only in a federal or state court located in the State of Delaware, and each party irrevocably submits to the jurisdiction of such courts for such purposes.

(Unchanged clause): This Agreement may not be assigned by either party without the prior written consent of the other party; any purported assignment in violation of this provision shall be null and void.

(Unchanged clause): This Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original and all of which taken together shall constitute one and the same instrument. Facsimile or electronic signatures shall be deemed to have the same legal effect as original signatures.

In the event that any provision of this Agreement shall be deemed invalid or unenforceable by a court of competent jurisdiction, then such provision shall be deemed modified to the minimum extent necessary to render it valid and enforceable, and the remainder of this Agreement shall continue in full force and effect. (Originally: In the event that any provision of this Agreement shall be found invalid or unenforceable by a court of competent jurisdiction, then such provision shall be severed from this Agreement and the remaining provisions shall be enforced.)

In this revised version, instead of the provision being severed if deemed invalid or unenforceable, it is now modified to the minimum extent necessary to make it valid and enforceable. This change makes the obligation slightly weaker by preserving the remainder of the agreement in case any part becomes invalid or unenforceable.
